topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559be5f16368720784000fc2#post_559be5f16368720784000fc2
We are weird people.

Let me tell you a tale of my memory span.

One day, I was sitting in the living room, just chilling and watching TV. At one point, my mom would ask me to help her or I would go to the toilet. Now, we had only one TV and one remote so in order to maintain my dominance over the remote, I decided to hide it. My siblings did it as well, even my mom did it. So, why the hell not? I hid my remote and did my thing. It didn't even last half an hour and as I sit back down on my couch, I noticed something was missing.

I lost the remote. And I forgot that I was the one that hid it.

I spent two hours searching for it and a quarter of the time, I spent watching TV by switching channels manually from the recorder. Afterwards, I was able to find it, got angry, insulted whoever that hid it (which was me, so basically insulted myself) and noticed another thing missing.

I lost the batteries, which I hid as well but forgot. 
So fuck.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559be8606368724978000707#post_559be8606368724978000707
Despite my memory being terrible, that was the one thing out of a few other things that I remembered. It wasn't even important or anything.

I hate having long term memories that aren't even important.
Like that one time, I saw a ghost besides me as I stared into a mirror.

Also, what's the movie about?
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
So what's scarier, something scary being illustrated visually or verbally? 
Because I've always felt like a scary story was scarier than a scary picture because a story uses your own imagination to build why it's scary whereas a picture just puts it all right in front of you
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559be9556368724836002536#post_559be9556368724836002536
Crime, mystery, drama and as with all Bollywood films lots of songs that bulk up the film more than it should. The protagonist's short-term memory loss plays a big part in the story.

And he's played by Amir Khan.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559bea316368722071000197#post_559bea316368722071000197
[bq="Too_Offensive"]So what's scarier, something scary being illustrated visually or verbally? 
Because I've always felt like a scary story was scarier than a scary picture because a story uses your own imagination to build why it's scary whereas a picture just puts it all right in front of you[/bq]
In my case is verbally
I remember when I was young, one of my cousins that lived with us watched the movie The Grudge. It was the first time I heard about that movie. Well, he made a resume of the movie plot, and told of about the ghost and the sounds she make. I couldn't sleep for weeks.
I was so scaried for a movie and a ghost that I haven't seen in my life.
